alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 4:45AM AKDT until March 19 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to midnight AKDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow is expected toward the mountains and around Kachemak Bay. Blowing snow will be the main threat from along the Sterling Highway from Kenai southward to Homer.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
